summary: An FBI email chain forwarding a report from retired FBI agent Jeffrey Carrie about overhearing a conversation in a New Jersey bar regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death. Carrie reported two women discussing money sent to a Swiss bank account after Epstein's death, four BOP employees involved who could retire soon, and alleged procedural failures at the jail.

events.title: Conversation Overheard at De Novo Bar
events.description: Retired FBI agent Jeffrey Carrie overheard two women discussing the Jeffrey Epstein case at the De Novo Bar in Montclair, NJ. The conversation included claims about money sent to a Swiss bank account after Epstein's death, four BOP employees involved, and alleged failures in jail procedures.

keyFacts: A retired FBI agent reported overhearing a conversation where a woman claimed money was sent to a Swiss bank account after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The conversation allegedly implicated four Bureau of Prisons (BOP) employees who could retire within the next year.
The speaker claimed procedural failures occurred at the jail, including moving Epstein's cellmate and correctional officers not performing proper checks.
The retired agent took photographs of the women and the license plate of one of their vehicles (an Acura) and provided them to the FBI.
